forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of snow after 3pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 34, with temperatures falling to around 32 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New snow accumulation of less than half an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow before 1am, then rain and snow likely. Cloudy. Low around 30, with temperatures rising to around 33 overnight. South southwest wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New snow accumulation of less than one inch possible. Little or no ice accumulation expected.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Evanston, the chill is palpable, with temperatures hovering in the low 30s. The atmosphere is thick with cloud cover, setting a moody scene as a brisk wind sweeps off Lake Michigan, turning what might be a pleasant coastal outing into a more blustery experience. The forecast hints at the possibility of snow beginning mid-afternoon, with a 50% chance of accumulation that could dust the area with less than half an inch before twilight descends.

Looking ahead, expect a transition to snow this evening, potentially mixing with rain as temperatures creep back up to the mid-30s. It's a day where bundling up is not just advisable but essential—layering with a warm coat, gloves, and perhaps a sturdy hat is recommended for venturing outdoors. The sandy beach may seem less inviting under the heavy cloud cover and with the impending precipitation, but for the brave souls willing to brave the elements, an invigorating winter walk could be just the thing to lift the spirits. With today being just a week before Christmas, one can almost feel the anticipation of the season in the air, even if it carries the crisp bite of winter.
